title: â€˜60 Minutesâ€™ Correspondent Says Bari Weiss Made a â€˜Politicalâ€™ Decision to Pull Segment on the â€˜Brutalâ€™ El Salvador Prison Where Trump Administration Sent Deportees
description: Bari Weiss, two months into her post as CBS Newsâ€˜ editor-in-chief, was responsible for spiking a â€œ60 Minutesâ€ segment on the â€œbrutal and tortuous co
body:
Bari Weiss, two months into her post as CBS Newsâ€˜ editor-in-chief, was responsible for spiking a â€œ60 Minutesâ€ segment on the â€œbrutal and tortuous conditionsâ€ at a prison in El Salvador where the Trump administration has deported alleged illegal immigrants for detention, according to reports.

	The CBS News program abruptly announced on Sunday â€” three hours before airtime â€” that it was delaying the segment for a future airdate. The report, as previously announced, was to have featured correspondent Sharyn Alfonsi interviewing deportees who the Trump administration has sent to the Centro de Confinamiento del Terrorismo (CECOT) prison in El Salvador.
	

	Weiss, after requesting â€œnumerous changes to the segment,â€ spiked the report on Saturday, the New York Times reported. Among Weissâ€™s suggestions: that the piece should include an interview with White House deputy chief of staff Stephen Miller or another senior Trump administration official. Weiss, according to the Times, gave Millerâ€™s contact info to the â€œ60 Minutesâ€ team working on the CECOT segment; Alfonsi said she already requested comment from the Department of Homeland Security, the White House and the State Department.


	Alfonsi, in an email to CBS colleagues Sunday that was first reported by the Wall Street Journal, wrote, â€œOur story was screened five times and cleared by both CBS attorneys and Standards and Practices. It is factually correct. In my view, pulling it now, after every rigorous internal check has been met, is not an editorial decision, it is a political one.â€

	Alfonsi also wrote, â€œWe have been promoting this story on social media for days. Our viewers are expecting it. When it fails to air without a credible explanation, the public will correctly identify this as corporate censorship. We are trading 50 years of â€˜Gold Standardâ€™ reputation for a single week of political quiet.â€
	

	Staffers at â€œ60 Minutesâ€ are â€œthreatening to quit over this,â€ CNN chief media analyst Brian Stelter tweeted.

	CBS News did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

	The incident came after President Trump two weeks ago complained about what he perceived was unfair treatment by â€œ60 Minutesâ€ â€” and asserted that since David Ellison and his father, wealthy Trump supporter Larry Ellison, close the deal to acquire Paramount (parent of CBS), â€œ60 Minutes has actually gotten WORSE!â€

	Last week, Trump blasted the Ellisons again over â€œ60 Minutes,â€ writing in a Dec. 16 post on his Truth Social account, â€œFor those people that think I am close with the new owners of CBS, please understand that 60 Minutes has treated me far worse since the so-called â€˜takeover,â€™ than they have ever treated me before. If they are friends, Iâ€™d hate to see my enemies!â€

	In an announcement Sunday, â€œ60 Minutesâ€ shared an â€œEditorâ€™s Noteâ€ that said: â€œThe broadcast lineupÂ for tonightâ€™s edition ofÂ â€˜60 Minutesâ€™ has been updated.Â Our report â€˜Inside CECOTâ€™ will air in a future broadcast.â€ The statement was posted on social media around 4:30 p.m. ET Sunday. The episode was slated to air at 7:30 p.m. ET on the East Coast (or following the conclusion of NFL coverage on CBS).

	Asked earlier why the segment was postponed, a CBS News spokesperson said, â€œThe â€™60 Minutesâ€™ report on â€˜Inside CECOTâ€™ will air in a future broadcast. We determined it needed additional reporting.â€


	According to the U.S.-based National Immigration Law Center, in March and April 2025, the U.S. government sent more than 280 young men to CECOT, â€œa foreign jail notorious forÂ torture, in secret, with no notice to their loved ones or attorneys. There, they were held incommunicado and tortured.â€ Four months later, 252 of the men were released from the prison and â€œsent to their native Venezuela (notably, a country that a number of the men had originally fled, fearing persecution),â€ according to the organization.

	Earlier this month, Trump slammed Lesley Stahlâ€™s â€œ60 Minutesâ€ interview that aired Dec. 7 with Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Georgia), the one-time Trump supporter who has recently been critical of the president on a range of issues. The president wrote on Truth Social that the â€œTrump-hatingâ€ Stahl interviewed â€œa very poorly prepared Traitor, who in her confusion made many really stupid statements.â€
	

	Trump continued: â€œMy real problem with the show, however, wasnâ€™t the low IQ traitor, it was that the new ownership of 60 Minutes, Paramount, would allow a show like this to air. THEY ARE NO BETTER THAN THE OLD OWNERSHIP.â€ Trump also pointed out thatÂ Paramount Global, seeking to complete its deal with Skydance Media, this summer paid the president $16 millionÂ to settle his lawsuit over a â€œ60 Minutesâ€ interview in October 2024 with Kamala Harris, which Trump claimed was deceptively edited and thus caused him personal harm and represented interference with the 2024 election.

	David Ellison in October announced a deal reportedly worth $150 million to acquire Weissâ€™ contrarian outlet The Free Press. He also appointed Weiss as CBS Newsâ€™ editor in chief. Industry observers speculated that was intended to improve CBS Newsâ€™ standing with Trump and the MAGA movement.

	Meanwhile, just a few months after closing the Skydance-Paramount deal, David Ellisonâ€™s Paramount Skydance has launched a hostile takeover bid for Warner Bros. Discovery, attempting to convince shareholders to reject WBDâ€™s deal with Netflix, which is set to acquire the Warner Bros. studios operations and HBO Max.

	Sundayâ€™s â€œ60 Minutes,â€ in place of the report on CECOT, aired a segment from correspondentÂ Jon Wertheim, described like this: â€œJon Wertheim travels to Nottingham, England, to visit the Kanneh-Mason family â€” seven siblings, each still under 30, all celebrated classical musicians whose talent is truly music to the ears. Supporting one another in harmony as they take to the worldâ€™s stage, this extraordinary septet, as Wertheim discovers, is an orchestra greater than the sum of its parts.â€

	The Dec. 21 episode of â€œ60 Minutesâ€ also featured a double-length segment on â€œThe Sherpas of Everest,â€ for which correspondentÂ Cecilia VegaÂ trekked to Everest Base Camp guided by a 19-year-old sherpa.

schema.headline: â€˜60 Minutesâ€™ Correspondent Says Bari Weiss Made a â€˜Politicalâ€™ Decision to Pull Segment on the â€˜Brutalâ€™ El Salvador Prison Where Trump Administration Sent Deportees

title: How to Watch CBS's Rob Reiner Special Live Online Streaming
description:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	CBS will
body:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	CBS will pay tribute to Rob Reiner and his legacy in a new special airing Sunday night. 

	Titled â€œRob Reiner â€“ Scenes From a Life,â€ the one-hour tribute will broadcast on Sunday, Dec. 21 at 8:30 p.m.  ET / 8:00 p.m. PT on CBS News and stream simultaneously on Paramount+. For viewers who prefer live TV bundles, services such as Hulu + Live TV, Fubo and DirecTV all carry CBS in most markets and will stream the tribute live.


	Produced by CBS News, â€œScenes From a Lifeâ€ will celebrate the career and cultural impact of Reiner, tracing his journey from sitcom stardom to one of Hollywoodâ€™s most reliable hitmakers. Friends and collaborators including Kathy Bates, Annette Bening, Albert Brooks, Michael Douglas, Kiefer Sutherland, Jerry Oâ€™Connell and Mandy Patinkin will share new interviews reflecting on Reinerâ€™s work and influence, while archival footage will revisit his own words across decades of CBS News conversations â€” including his final sit-down with Lesley Stahl on â€œ60 Minutesâ€ earlier this fall.


	The special will also revisit defining titles from Reinerâ€™s filmography, including â€œThe Princess Bride,â€ â€œWhen Harry Met Sally,â€ â€œMisery,â€ â€œThis Is Spinal Tap,â€ â€œThe American Presidentâ€ andâ€ Stand by Me,â€ alongside his breakout work as Meathead on â€œAll in the Family.â€ 

	CBS moved quickly to assemble the tribute following the news of Reinerâ€™s death. Reiner and his wife, Michele Singer Reiner, were found dead in their Los Angeles home on Sunday, Dec. 14. Their son Nick Reiner has been arrested in connection with the deaths. 

	An editorâ€™s note from CBS confirms that â€œScenes From a Lifeâ€ will replace previously announced programming in the networkâ€™s Sunday lineup. For viewers without cable, Paramount+ with Showtime remains the easiest way to watch the special live.

schema.headline: How to Watch CBS's Rob Reiner Special Live Online Streaming

title: â€˜Landmanâ€™: Guy Burnet on Charlie and Rebeccaâ€™s Hot Chemistry, Shooting That â€˜Nakedâ€™ Bedroom Scene and His Bond With Superfan Arnold Schwarzenegger
description: SPOILER ALERT:Â This post contains spoilers from Season 2, Episode 6 of â€œLandman,â€ â€œDark Night of the Soul,â€ which premiered Sunday, Dec. 21, on Para
body:
SPOILER ALERT:Â This post contains spoilers from Season 2, Episode 6 of â€œLandman,â€ â€œDark Night of the Soul,â€ which premiered Sunday, Dec. 21, on Paramount+.

	Guy Burnet has only been on two episodes of â€œLandman,â€ but heâ€™s already made a big impact.

	Burnet plays Charlie, a M-Tex geologist who had a one-night stand with Rebecca (Kayla Wallace) after a traumatic (and drunken) plane ride. Yet Rebecca had no idea they were both employed by M-Tex â€”Â and that sheâ€™s technically senior to him, breaking corporate rules â€”Â until she traveled to meet him at an informational meeting during this weekâ€™s episode.
	

	Itâ€™s been a treat getting to see the high-strung Rebecca let her hair down around the suave Charlie, and the charactersâ€™ chemistry is electric. In an interview with Variety, Burnet is quick to praise his scene partner as essential to bringing the spark to their scenes.


	â€œI think the secret behind it is having two people who are game to do something more, to elevate something,â€ he says. â€œKayla is the opposite of her character. She is this wonderfully kind and generous and gentle human being. When I first went out to Texas, I got her information and said, â€˜Hey, would you like to meet?â€™ Some actors just want to turn up and do the job. Sheâ€™s not that way, and we share the same philosophy of, â€˜Letâ€™s do something fun here. Letâ€™s build something.â€™ So we met up and talked about life and shared stories, and got on well. Kayla and I have a real protectiveness of each other, and we bring that chemistry to the characters and let that be natural.â€

	Burnet, who has also acted in series like â€œFUBARâ€ and â€œCounterpartâ€ and films like â€œOppenheimerâ€ and â€œPitch Perfect 3,â€ had the additional challenge of not just being emotionally vulnerable in his first episodes, but also putting it all out there physically as well. On his first episode, both Charlie and Rebecca woke up from their wild night in various states of disrobe, which can be challenging for even the most fearless and dashing actors. But Burnet thought about the situation and his characterâ€™s state of mind a little differently.
	

	â€œLetâ€™s be honest, Iâ€™m not Chris Hemsworth,â€ Burnet says. â€œEveryoneâ€™s a beefcake these days in these Marvel movies. Do I work out? Yeah, I train, and I box, but Iâ€™m not a lot like those guys, so whatever. I got to give up at some point and go, â€˜All right, this is me. Iâ€™m fine, whatever.â€™ The first thing we shot was that bedroom scene. Iâ€™m coming in naked. Kayla is so abundantly beautiful, and in my mind, Iâ€™m going, â€˜Why would she want to be with me?â€™ And then Iâ€™m like, even in my head, genuinely at the time, â€˜The audience is going to be like, â€œOh, come on.â€â€˜ The character is happy-go-lucky, and he just gets lucky. Sheâ€™s out of his league. Thatâ€™s how I see it. If it develops from there, heâ€™s hit the jackpot. I donâ€™t think it actually was nerve-wracking because I kind of gave up. I was just like, â€˜Whatever, man. I got lucky. She is probably never going to want to see me again. So Iâ€™ll just say goodbye,â€™ and the fates intervened.â€

	Fans will definitely get to know Burnet more this season, and while he canâ€™t spoil specifics, heâ€™s excited to show different sides of the character.

	â€œAs you can see already, thereâ€™s obviously a very strong chemistry that Rebecca and Charlie have,â€ he says. â€œI think that develops both of their characters. She becomes a bit more three-dimensional, which then allows you to learn more about him. Thatâ€™s really to drive her character and her story. Iâ€™m here to serve that story. Also, he has a natural set of skills that are needed that can bring him into the M-Tex world, which would involve the other characters, and who knows where beyond that. So itâ€™s naturally gonna transition from just their bubble into the greater scheme of things.â€

	As his role grows, Burnet has one key support figure in his life: His good friend and â€œLandmanâ€ superfan Arnold Schwarzenegger, who he grew close with while shooting â€œFUBAR.â€

	â€œAlong the way in this job, you get to meet some cool people,â€ Burnet says. â€œIf youâ€™re lucky enough, you stay in touch. Arnold is such a special, special person. Heâ€™s saved me in situations â€”Â Iâ€™m not going to say that lightly, and I wonâ€™t get into what, but when I needed somebody, he was there. He checks in on me all the time. He believes in me more than nearly anyone Iâ€™ve ever come across. He makes me believe in myself. Heâ€™ll call to check in with me: â€˜Whatâ€™s going on? How are you doing mental health-wise?â€™ And his favorite show is â€˜Landman,â€™ and he calls and sends me messages and loves it. I consider that relationship one of the great things thatâ€™s ever happened for me.â€

schema.headline: â€˜Landmanâ€™: Guy Burnet on Charlie and Rebeccaâ€™s Hot Chemistry, Shooting That â€˜Nakedâ€™ Bedroom Scene and His Bond With Superfan Arnold Schwarzenegger

title: Kumail Nanjiani Says Heâ€™s â€˜Very Proudâ€™ of His Performance in Marvelâ€™s â€˜Eternalsâ€™: â€˜I Do Not Get to Choose What the Reviewers Are Going to Thinkâ€™
description: Kumail Nanjiani got candid about his experience working on the critically panned Marvel movie â€œEternalsâ€ on a recent episode of NPRâ€™s Wild Card with
body:
Kumail Nanjiani got candid about his experience working on the critically panned Marvel movie â€œEternalsâ€ on a recent episode of NPRâ€™s Wild Card with Rachel Martin, saying that the film changed how he approached work â€” something heâ€™s â€œvery grateful for.â€Â 

	â€œIâ€™m very proud of my performance in it,â€ he said. â€œAnd itâ€™s rare to say, but I actually wouldnâ€™t change anything about how I am in that movie.â€Â 


	The actor and comedian played the superhero Kingo in the 2021 fantasy film alongside other stars Kit Harington, Richard Madden, Gemma Chan and Angelina Jolie. Despite the stacked cast, the film opened to disappointing box office and lukewarm reviews from critics.Â 
	

	On the podcast, Nanjiani went on to share his biggest takeaways from the experience, including the importance of separating â€œmy experience of something versus the result of something.â€Â 

	â€œMost times if Iâ€™m acting in something, I do not get to decide how good itâ€™s gonna be,â€ the â€œSilicon Valleyâ€ star explained. â€œI do not get to choose how the audience is going to receive it. I do not get to choose how much money itâ€™s going to make. I do not get to choose what the reviewers are going to think of it. What I do get to choose is whether or not I learned from it, you know? So to me, thatâ€™s been a thing that I have to remind myself over and over and over and over â€“ is that a failure is not a failure. It truly is an opportunity to learnâ€¦ What I can control is learning from every job and taking a joyful approach to every job.â€Â 

	In the past, Nanjiani has been open about his feelings around the project, discussing how the negative reception of â€œEternalsâ€ led him to therapy on fellow stand-up comedian Mike Birbigliaâ€™s â€œWorking It Outâ€ podcast.Â 
	

	â€œI signed on for six movies,â€ said Nanjiani. â€œThey make you sign up for all this stuffâ€¦ and then none of that happened.â€

	Most recently, the actor returned to the stage for the first time in a decade for his newly released Hulu comedy special â€œNight Thoughts. â€

schema.headline: Kumail Nanjiani Says Heâ€™s â€˜Very Proudâ€™ of His Performance in Marvelâ€™s â€˜Eternalsâ€™: â€˜I Do Not Get to Choose What the Reviewers Are Going to Thinkâ€™

title: James Ransone, Who Played Ziggy Sobotka on â€˜The Wire,â€™ Dies at 46
description: James Ransone, the actor known for playing Ziggy Sobotka in â€œThe Wireâ€ and Eddie Kaspbrak in â€œIt: Chapter Two,â€ died by hanging on Friday, according
body:
James Ransone, the actor known for playing Ziggy Sobotka in â€œThe Wireâ€ and Eddie Kaspbrak in â€œIt: Chapter Two,â€ died by hanging on Friday, according to the Los Angeles County Medical Examiner. He was 46.

	Ransone appeared as the dock worker-turned-petty criminal, Chester â€œZiggyâ€ Sabotka, in 12 episodes of â€œThe Wireâ€ Season 2. Over the course of his arc, Ziggy was easily pushed around by other low-level criminals and his fellow cargo checkers. After being delivered one too many indignities, Ziggy snaps and takes out his partner in a fit of rage. Horrified at his actions, he waits for the police to arrive on the scene and confesses to the killings. His final appearance in the show is during the Season 2 finale, where he is seen carrying out his prison sentence. 
	

	Five years later, Ransone starred alongside Alexander SkarsgÃ¥rd in â€œGeneration Kill.â€ He played real life marine Cpl. Josh Ray Person across all seven episodes of the HBO mini-series, which followed a Rolling Stone reporter embedded with the 1st Recon Marines.


	In 2019, Ransone played the older version of the meek, Derry-born limo driver Eddie Kaspbrak in â€œIt: Chapter Two.â€ His other recent film credits include â€œBlack Phone 2,â€ â€œV/H/S/85,â€ â€œSmall Engine Repairâ€ and â€œWhat We Found.â€ 

	His recent TV credits include â€œPoker Face,â€ â€œSeal Team,â€ â€œ50 States of Frightâ€ and â€œThe First.â€ 

	Ransone was born in Baltimore in 1979. He attended the Carver Center for Arts and Technology in Towson, Md., from 1993 to 1997. He got his break co-starring in the 2002 teen drama â€œKen Park.â€ He landed his role on â€œThe Wireâ€ a year later. 
	

	If you or anyone you know is having thoughts of suicide, please call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 988 or go to SpeakingOfSuicide.com/resources.

schema.headline: James Ransone, Who Played Ziggy Sobotka on â€˜The Wire,â€™ Dies at 46

title: â€˜Landmanâ€™ Season 2 Episode 6: Craziest Moments and Burning Questions, From a Fightinâ€™ Grandpa and a Flirtinâ€™ Geologist to Tommy Potentially Getting Fired
description:
Dec 21, 2025 1:01pm PT	
	

	
		â€˜Landmanâ€™ Season 2 Episode 6: Craziest Moments and Burning Questions, From a Fightinâ€™ Grandpa and a F
body:
Dec 21, 2025 1:01pm PT	
	

	
		â€˜Landmanâ€™ Season 2 Episode 6: Craziest Moments and Burning Questions, From a Fightinâ€™ Grandpa and a Flirtinâ€™ Geologist to Tommy Potentially Getting Fired
	
	
			


			
			
	

									Courtesy of Paramount+
	

		
	
				
	SPOILER ALERT:Â This post contains spoilers from Season 2, Episode 6 of â€œLandman,â€ â€œDark Night of the Soul,â€ which premiered Sunday, Dec. 21, on Paramount+.

	Well, â€œLandmanâ€ fans, a lot went down in this episode. T.L. (Sam Elliott) punched a guy who disrespected his wife; Rebecca (Kayla Wallace) realized that a guy she hooked up with was her subordinate; and Cami (Demi Moore) doesnâ€™t seem to trust Tommy (Billy Bob Thornton) at all anymore. Power dynamics are shifting around quickly! On to the episode:
	


Why does Tommy always need to drive three hours, have a meeting and drive three hours back? Canâ€™t they do a Zoom and save him the travel time?
Smart move to dodge the question, Dale (James Jordan)!
Oh man, Nate (Colm Feore) is such a drag! Just enjoy the Mexican food!
Good on Dale ignoring tech salesmen hawking equipment that means good men will get laid off. But bonus points for taking their swag and free gifts anyway!
Aww, itâ€™s cute that Boss (Mustafa Speaks) is a wife guy. Smart man!
Booâ€¦down with robots!
Tommy, tell Cooper (Jacob Lofland) to just Google what wedding rings cost. It would have saved you in the end!
Ugh, Ainsley (Michelle Randolph) â€¦ lame transphobic joke. Do better, weâ€™re rooting for you!
Shout out to Angela (Ali Larter) for being so selfless by offering her ring. Thatâ€™s nice!
â€œDiamonds are in Dallas.â€ Iâ€™m always saying that!
T.L.â€™s â€œmonkey on a runaway dogâ€ analogy is spot-on!
Aww, look at these two sticks in the mud laughing together. Fun!
More â€œGulf of Americaâ€ discussion? Taylor Sheridan clearly feels some type of way about Trumpâ€™s renaming of the area.
Does anyone truly understand the business talk on this show? Nothing makes me feel stupider. I assume itâ€™s all correct, as it sounds complicated!
Nate, just let Rebecca be a boss! Your dignity doesnâ€™t interest me.
What a long, sinister name for a horse! I thought you named them â€œDominoâ€ or somethingâ€¦
Tommy really brought down a fun day between Gallino (Andy Garcia) and Cami. In fact, Gallino is so thoughtful that I believe him nowâ€¦what drug money? Heâ€™s clean!
Woah! Rebecca has to work with hot geologist / former fling / double entendre machine Charlie (Guy Burnet) on this project. The chemistry is already great, and heâ€™s being SO flirtatiousâ€¦gimme more!
Damn, Cami is still pulling rank over Tommy. This negotiation barely involved him at all â€¦ might she fire him from M-Tex eventually?
Loved T.L. beating up Nash (Robert Morgan). Sure, T.L. was being a dick, but itâ€™s fun to see Elliott get in on the action.
Get Elliott an Emmy! This scene is so sad.
That was a well-shot moment too, with Tommy and T.L. mostly in shadows. Metaphors abound!
Going on an outrageous shopping spree with Angela and Ainsley is a new life goal.
Good angry/hot makeout.
Aww, Cooper is making an effort with Ariana (Paulina Chavez)!



	Until next week, share what you would name a prize horse in the comments.



	
		More from Variety
	
	
					

			
			
			
			
	
			
					

			
			
			
			
	
			
					

			
			
			
			
	
			
					

			
			
			
			
	
			
					

			
			
			
			
	
			
					

			
			
			
			
	
			
			
	
			
		

		

	
		More From Our Brands
	
	
		

			
	
			
			

	Rolling Stone

					Kate Winslet Recalls Her Phone Being Tapped in the Wake of â€˜Titanicâ€™ Success		

					
				
			
			
	
			
	
		
			
	
			
			

	Robb Report

					The Champagne Made With Rare, Ancient Grapes		

					
				
			
			
	
			
	
		
			
	
			
			

	Sportico

					First Riverside Abuse Trial Nearsâ€”and Evidence Takes Center Stage

title: Jimmy Kimmel to Deliver â€˜Deeply Personalâ€™ Christmas Day Message on U.K.â€™s Channel 4
description:
Jimmy Kimmel is set to give the 2025 Alternative Christmas Message for U.K. network Channel 4. 

	Sometimes humorous, sometimes serious, the famed m
body:
Jimmy Kimmel is set to give the 2025 Alternative Christmas Message for U.K. network Channel 4. 

	Sometimes humorous, sometimes serious, the famed message â€”Â which will air on Christmas Day â€”Â has become an annual tradition of Channel 4â€™s and serves as an alternative to the British monarchâ€™s televised address to the nation. Various well-known yet unexpected names have given the address since it first started in 1993, with Kimmel following in the footsteps of former Iranian president Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, whistleblower Edward Snowden and French screen icon Brigitte Bardot. 
	

	According to the network, Kimmelâ€™s message will see him reflect on the last few months â€”Â including the hugely controversial suspension by ABC of â€œJimmy Kimmel Liveâ€ following a monologue made in the wake of Charlie Kirkâ€™s murder â€”Â in a â€œdeeply personal and characteristically jovial address.â€


	It asserted that Kimmelâ€™s Christmas message includes the line, â€œFrom a fascism perspective, this has been a really great year.â€

	In his final monologue of 2025 for â€œJimmy Kimmel Live,â€ the chat show host teared up as he thanked fans for helping him get through a difficult year. Alongside ABC briefly pulling his late night talk show off the air and Kimmelâ€™s ongoing feud with President Donald Trump, he also lost his childhood best friend â€”Â and â€œJimmy Kimmel Liveâ€ bandleader â€” Cleto Escobedo III, who died in November. 

	â€œThis has been a strange year. Itâ€™s been a hard year,â€ Kimmel said at the beginning of the last â€œJimmy Kimmel Liveâ€ episode of the year on Dec. 19. â€œWeâ€™ve had some lows, weâ€™ve had some highs. For me, maybe more than any year of my life. Iâ€™m crying already, Iâ€™m sorry.â€
	

	Kimmel fought through tears and continued, â€œI just want to say that we appreciate your support, your enthusiasm, and not just for watching. This year, you literally pulled us out of a hole, and we cannot thank you enough personally.â€

schema.headline: Jimmy Kimmel to Deliver â€˜Deeply Personalâ€™ Christmas Day Message on U.K.â€™s Channel 4

title: Charlamagne Tha God Inks Five-Year Deal Renewal With iHeartMedia
description: iHeartMedia extended its relationship with multimedia mogul Charlamagne Tha God, co-host of hit radio show â€œThe Breakfast Clubâ€ and founder of The B
body:
iHeartMedia extended its relationship with multimedia mogul Charlamagne Tha God, co-host of hit radio show â€œThe Breakfast Clubâ€ and founder of The Black Effect podcast network, for five more years.

	Since 2010, Charlamagne has co-hosted the â€œThe Breakfast Club,â€ which airs on iHeartMedia New Yorkâ€™s Power 105â€™s and is syndicated nationally. 

	In announcing the deal, iHeart called him â€œone of the worldâ€™s most well-informed, authoritative and distinctive media personalities,â€ who has â€œbecome a crucial and influential voice in American culture.â€ Under the new multiyear agreement, Charlamagne will continue his â€œuninhibitedâ€ trademark interview style on the award-winning â€œThe Breakfast Clubâ€ radio show, weekdays from 6-10 a.m. ET, as well as â€œWeekends With The Breakfast Club,â€ alongside co-hosts DJ Envy, Jess Hilarious and Loren LoRosa.
	

	Starting in 2026, Netflix will exclusively stream video versions of â€œThe Breakfast Club,â€ one of more than a dozen iHeartMedia shows covered under the companiesâ€™ recent licensing pact. Audio-only episodes of â€œThe Breakfast Clubâ€ (and the other iHeart programs) will continue to be available on major platforms like Spotify and Apple Podcasts.


	â€œWhen it comes to iHeartMedia, gratitude will always be my attitude,â€ Charlamagne Tha God said in a statement. â€œTheyâ€™ve created space for me to grow not just as talent, but as an executive and true partner through The Black Effect Podcast Network.â€ 

	He continued, â€œTo say that Iâ€™m thankful is an understatement. iHeart is the biggest and best audio company on the planet and audio is the foundation on which the whole media conglomerate will be built. Podcasting, live events, TV/film and documentaries, the sky is the limit for where we are going; and radio will always be at the core of it. Hereâ€™s to a new era of growth, impact, and prosperity.â€
	

	â€œThe Breakfast Club,â€ celebrating its 15-year milestone this month, has become â€œthe bullhorn for modern cultureâ€ and is widely regarded as â€œthe most informative and entertaining top-rated contemporary Hip-Hop/R&B morning show today,â€ according to iHeartMedia. Guests who have appeared on the show over the years include President Barack Obama, President Joe Biden, Vice President Kamala Harris, Jay-Z, Cardi B, Kendrick Lamar, Kevin Hart, Snoop Dogg, Future, 50 Cent, Lizzo, Will Smith and Alicia Keys. The crewâ€™s â€œWeekends With The Breakfast Clubâ€ is a three-hour weekly program featuring a countdown of the top 20 songs on the charts along with signature interviews. Charlamagne Tha God and â€œThe Breakfast Clubâ€ were inducted into the Radio Hall of Fame in 2020.

	SEE ALSO: How Charlamagne Tha God Built His Empire and Is Using His Platform to Lift Up Black Artists: â€˜If What You Build Only Benefits You, Itâ€™s Not Big Enoughâ€™

	â€œCharlamagne has been a transformative voice in audio, redefining what it means to create content that sparks dialogue and drives cultural change,â€ said Richâ€¯Bressler, iHeartMediaâ€™s president and COO. â€œThrough â€˜The Breakfast Clubâ€™ and his growing podcast network, heâ€™s amplified diverse voices, tackled tough conversations, and built platforms that continue to resonate with audiences nationwide. His influence has helped shape the future of audio and weâ€™re energized by what lies ahead and appreciate his ongoing trust in iHeart.â€

	iHeart and Charlamagne will continue to partner on the joint venture, The Black Effect Podcast Network â€” the worldâ€™s largest podcast publisher dedicated to Black listeners, bringing together leading voices in Black culture for stimulating conversations around social justice, pop culture, sports, mental health, news, comedy and more. Launched in 2020 and curated by Charlamagne, The Black Effect has debuted more than 60 shows, generating about 11 million monthly downloads and featuring a roster of marquee talent.

	Earlier this year, â€œThe Breakfast Clubâ€ replay podcast â€” which served as the flagship show for the launch of The Black Effect Podcast Network â€” surpassed 1 billion downloads, joining a very short list of podcasts to reach the milestone.
	

	Lenard â€œCharlamagne Tha Godâ€ McKelvey also founded Southland Stories, a film production company created to spotlight authentic, impactful storytelling. Outside of media, Charlamagne established the Mental Wealth Alliance to advance mental health awareness and provide resources in underserved communities.

	In the deal with iHeartMedia, Charlamagne Tha God was represented by Ted Chervin at CAA, with legal counsel provided by Loan Dang of Del Shaw Moonves Tanaka Finkelstein Lezcano Bobb & Dang. Financial strategy and advisory were led by Humble Lukanga and Laura Rutebuka of Lifeline Financial Group. The agreement was developed in close partnership with Charlamagneâ€™s longtime business partner Karen Kinney of KK Entertainment & Media.

schema.headline: Charlamagne Tha God Inks Five-Year Deal Renewal With iHeartMedia

title: Box Office â€˜Avatar: Fire and Ashâ€™ Powers to $345 Million Globally, â€˜Zootopia 2â€™ Hops to $1.27 Billion
description: James Cameronâ€™s sci-fi epic â€œAvatar: Fire and Ashâ€ loomed large over the global box office with $345 million, a robust start thatâ€™s nonetheless a si
body:
James Cameronâ€™s sci-fi epic â€œAvatar: Fire and Ashâ€ loomed large over the global box office with $345 million, a robust start thatâ€™s nonetheless a significant decline from its predecessor. To compare, â€œAvatar: The Way of Water,â€ which opened in 2022 after countless release date delays, ignited to $435 million over the same frame.

	Initial ticket sales for â€œAvatar 3,â€ from Disney and 20th Century, include $257 million internationally and $88 million domestically. Globally, this is the second-largest debut of 2025 behind another Disney juggernaut, â€œZootopia 2,â€ which earned $500 million over the three-day period.
	

	â€œAvatar: Fire and Ashâ€ certainly has a high bar to clear in terms of theatrical expectations because the first two trips to Pandora were smash hits to the tune of above $2 billion at the global box office. Plus, Disney spent a massive $350 million to produce and roughly $150 million to promote, meaning the big-budget blockbuster needs to earn a lot of coin to justify its mega budget.


	In that regard, â€œAvatarâ€ installments have become ubiquitous for their box office longevity. Neither 2009â€™s â€œAvatarâ€ nor â€œThe Way of Waterâ€ had particularly shattering opening weekends ahead of Christmas, but both remained the de facto choice for moviegoers well into the new year. They stand as two of the highest-grossing movies in history with $2.9 billion and $2.3 billion, respectively.

	International audiences will be key to the threequelâ€™s commercial success. The original adventure â€œAvatarâ€ earned a mammoth $2.1 billion from just overseas markets, while the sequel generated a massive $1.65 billion from foreign territories. 
	

	â€œThe first two movies earned over 70% of their box office overseas,â€ says David A. Gross, who runs the movie consulting firm Franchise Entertainment Research.Â â€œSo far, the foreign openings are extremely strong again.â€

	Thatâ€™s led by China, where â€œFire and Ashâ€ started slightly stronger than its predecessor with $57.6 million, a touch above the $56 million debut of â€œThe Way of Water.â€ Outside of China, the top overseas launches were France with $21.4 million, Germany with $18 million, Korea with $13.6 million and the United Kingdom with $11.9 million.

	â€œAvatarâ€ movies are known as visual spectacles, so itâ€™s no surprise that moviegoers opted to watch the third entry in the best possible quality. Premium formats such as Imax and 3D represented a notable 66% of total grosses. Imax alone delivered $43.6 million globally, registering as nearly 14% of the worldwide bow on less than 1% of screens. Those sales mark Imaxâ€™s biggest opening of 2025 as well as the fifth-largest start in the companyâ€™s history.

	â€œAs James Cameron continues to break new ground with Avatar, the indelible connection between Imax and this one-of-a-kind franchise endures, with Imax delivering an outsized share of the box office across virtually every market worldwide,â€ said Rich Gelfond, CEO of Imax. â€œAvatar films have historically played with longevity like few other franchises, and we look forward to fans continuing to enjoy â€˜Avatar: Fire and Ashâ€™ in big numbers in Imax throughout the holiday season and beyond.â€

	Disney also scored over the weekend as â€œZootopia 2â€ collected a remarkable $76.6 million overseas and $91 million globally in its fourth frame. The animated sequel has been a powerhouse at the international box office with $990 million to date. Itâ€™s about to become only the second animated film ever (â€œInside Out 2â€ was the first) to surpass $1 billion in international ticket sales. Along with $282 million in North America, â€œZootopia 2â€ has hopped to $1.27 billion worldwide to stand as the highest-grossing Hollywood release of the year.

schema.headline: Box Office â€˜Avatar: Fire and Ashâ€™ Powers to $345 Million Globally, â€˜Zootopia 2â€™ Hops to $1.27 Billion

title: Nicki Minaj Joins Erika Kirk for Turning Point Q&A, Reaffirming Anti-Trans, Pro-Trump Views and, in a Faux Pas, Praising â€˜the Assassin JD Vanceâ€™
description: Nicki Minaj sat for a conversation with Erika Kirk at the Turning Point USA conference in Phoenix Sunday morning, calling conservative activists â€œth
body:
Nicki Minaj sat for a conversation with Erika Kirk at the Turning Point USA conference in Phoenix Sunday morning, calling conservative activists â€œthe cool kidsâ€ in the midst of extolling her growing admiration for the current administration and her disdain for the usurping of traditional gender roles.

	The most unfortunately memorable moment came when the superstar rapper praised â€œthe assassin JD Vance,â€ leading to some awkward silence, with Kirkâ€™s husband Charlie having been cut down by a sniper three and a half months ago. Erika Kirk came around to acknowledging there had been a faux pas on Minajâ€™s part, but added that it was OK because â€œwe know whatâ€™s in your heart..â€ 
	

	Minaj further expressed her complete â€œrespect and admirationâ€ for â€œthe handsome, dashingâ€ President Trump; elaborated on her recent anti-trans statements; dug deeper into her antipathy for trans-supportive California governor Gavin Newsom; and suggested that white women have been the victims of reverse discrimination, as the beauty of Black women has been elevated.


	The â€œassassinâ€ slip-up came when Kirk asked what advice the performer would have for young men.

	â€œDonâ€™t be Newscum,â€ she began, repeating her epithet for Newsom. â€œYoung men, you have amazing role models like our handsome, dashing president, and you have amazing role models like the assassin JD Vance, our vice president. And when I say thatâ€¦â€ She then fell into uncharacteristic silence, perhaps realizing that trying to reel that back could make it worse.

	Picking up the ball amid the confusion about the remark, Kirk said, â€œTrust me, thereâ€™s nothing new under the sun that I have not heard. So youâ€™re fine. â€¦ You have to laugh about it, truly. I have been called every single thing, and you know what? God is so good. You let it roll right off your back and this is whatâ€™s so beautiful about this moment, because if the internet wants to clip it, who cares? I love Nicki. Sheâ€™s an amazing woman. She has a soul and a heart for the Lord. And words are words, but I know her heart and it doesnâ€™t even matter. And you say what you want to say, because I know your heart and I will not judge that, sister.â€
	

WATCH â€” @NICKIMINAJ refers to JD Vance as an â€œassassinâ€ when talking about what great role models and how handsome he and Trump are ğŸ™ƒâ€¦ then realizes sheâ€™s on stage with Erika Kirk, who tries to save her ğŸ˜¬ pic.twitter.com/4zmeZ3fgg0â€” The Tennessee Holler (@TheTNHoller) December 21, 2025


	Asked by Minaj about backlash she has faced for her now-right-leaning views, Minaj â€” who has devoted her recent social media to being combative on these issues â€” drew cheers as she claimed: â€œI didnâ€™t noticeâ€¦ We donâ€™t even think about themâ€¦ Weâ€™re the cool kids. The other people, theyâ€™re the ones who are disgruntled, but really theyâ€™re just disgruntled with themselves.â€

	Minaj made it clear that there has been a total turnaround in her political thinking from the days when she could be counted on to knock Trump along with her hip-hop peers. Asked by Kirk if there is â€œsomething that you want to leave as a legacy in this world for your family, for your baby, for just everything,â€ Minaj responded: â€œThat itâ€™s okay to change your mind.â€ 

	â€œThereâ€™s sometimes thereâ€™s a lot of things projected onto you when you change your own mind. You know, they project fear, shame, onto people who donâ€™t think and do as they think and do. But Iâ€™ve performed for huge crowds all around the world, and no matter how many songs I do on that stage, it didnâ€™t mean as much as this. Because this is a direct link for younger people. This is a direct link between young people and God, and thereâ€™s been a lack of that in our media, in our everyday conversations.â€

	Minaj was effusive with her support for the MAGA movement and its leaders. â€œI have the utmost respect and admiration for our presidentâ€¦ heâ€™s given so many people hope that thereâ€™s a chance to beat the bad guys and to win and to do it with your head held high and your integrity intact. â€¦ This administration is full of people with heart and soul., and they make me proud of them.â€

	The rapper called for keeping politicians without what she sees as respect for faith out of office. â€œI truly feel that there are people out there who felt good about chastising Christians right here in our country. And itâ€™s kind of really, really sick,â€ she said. â€œWe canâ€™t let people like that be in power, you guys. Thatâ€™s the truth. I can sugarcoat it and laugh and tee-hee, but the truth is, I am here today to tell you guys that we absolutely cannot let people who have a problem with us worshipping Godâ€¦ we cannot have them in power.â€

	Minaj indicated that, even beyond her beliefs about trans youths, she feels boys are discouraged from being masculine. â€œBoys, be boys,â€ she said repeatedly. â€œItâ€™s OK. Be boys. Thereâ€™s nothing wrong with being a boyâ€¦ How powerful is that? How profound is that? Boys will be boys and thereâ€™s nothing wrong with that.â€ â€œAmen,â€ Kirk responded, repeatedly, as Minaj laughed and stretched her arms out in a pose of triumph.
	

	On the subject of girls and young women, Minaj said, â€œRecently in the media, it is almost been like a push to not just making young Black children feel proud of themselves, but itâ€™s almost like doing that and at the same time telling other children not to be proud of themselves. And I donâ€™t want any child feeling that way. If we as Black women felt that we were not being represented and not being admired for our beautyâ€¦ why would we want to do that to other women? Why would we now need to make other people downplay their beauty so that we can feelâ€¦ no, thatâ€™s not how it works. I donâ€™t need someone with blonde hair and blue eyes to downplay their beauty, because I know my beauty.â€

Minaj: Recently in the media it's almost been like a push to â€” it's not just making young black children feel proud of themselves, but almost like doing that, and at the same time telling other children not to be proud of themselves.I don't need someone with blonde hair andâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/vJHAFvZHlsâ€” Acyn (@Acyn) December 21, 2025


	She elaborated: â€œI donâ€™t want what was done to little Black girls done to little white girls. I donâ€™t want it done to any girls. I want all the little girls in the world to know that you are unique, you are beautiful, you are you, and you can compliment another girl. You can compliment another woman and still know that you are epic and amazing. So thatâ€™s what I would say about for the girls. â€¦ I know my adults understand clearly where Iâ€™m going with that.â€

	She continued, â€œI donâ€™t like people making other people feel badly about themselves in any way. We need to nurture young girls whether they are Black, white, Asian, Hispanic, they still need to be nurtured. They cannot continue to pay for other peopleâ€™s sins. They havenâ€™t done anything wrong.â€

	Although Minaj did not invoke DEI directly, Vance, in following her appearance with his own speech, made it clear that thatâ€™s what he believed Minaj was talking about. Vance spoke of consigning diversity and inclusiveness initiatives to â€œthe dustbin of history,â€ adding that â€œin the United States of America, you donâ€™t have to apologize for being white anymoreâ€¦ We base people on who they are, not on ethnicity and things they canâ€™t control.â€

	Minaj finished on a note of somberly warning that it not just Nigeria, which she first raised as a cause, that is rampant with anti-Christian discrimination â€” it is America, too, in her view. And she invoked the Biden administration as having fostered this alleged bias against Christians.

	â€œLook at what is being done to Christians all around the world. And ask yourself why people in this country that were in positions of power felt so comfortable to try to take our voices from us. They were that afraid. They are that intimidated. They are that insecure. They are that small inside that hearing us and seeing us worship God irritated them. Our spirit irritates them because when we speak, they get shown up. When the truth walks in the room, the lies hide. They donâ€™t come out willingly. You gotta pry it out of them. They hide because they donâ€™t want you or anyone to know who they really are behind closed doors, because even they know how evil it is to try to deprive people of worshipping God.â€
	

	â€œWe love you, Nicki Minaj,â€ said Kirk.

	The White House subsequently tweeted posts of Minajâ€™s full-throated endorsement of the Trump administration.

ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ Trump has "given so many people hope that there's a chance to beat the bad guys, & to win, & to do it with your head held high & your integrity in tact. This administration is filled with people with heart & soul." MAKES US FEEL PROUD TO BE AN AMERICAN ğŸ”¥ @NICKIMINAJ pic.twitter.com/xkQosoncqIâ€” The White House (@WhiteHouse) December 21, 2025

schema.headline: Nicki Minaj Joins Erika Kirk for Turning Point Q&A, Reaffirming Anti-Trans, Pro-Trump Views and, in a Faux Pas, Praising â€˜the Assassin JD Vanceâ€™

title: 'The Wire' Star James Ransone Dead at 46 After Apparent Suicide
description:
Actor James Ransone
                          Dead at 46 ...
                          'The Wire,
body:
Actor James Ransone
                          Dead at 46 ...
                          'The Wire,' 'It: Chapter Two' Star
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              
                December 21, 2025
                
                            11:18 AM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  December 21, 2025
                                5:48 PM PST
                                    
      
    
          James Ransone -- an actor best known for his role in the hit show "The Wire" -- has died by suicide, according to the Los Angeles Medical Examiner ... TMZ has learned.
      
    
          TMZ has independently confirmed the star passed away Friday ... and the M.E.'s website lists the manner of death as suicide by hanging. We've also learned the Los Angeles Police Department responded to a call to a residence, where officers completed a death investigation report and no foul play was suspected.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Ransone started appearing in small roles in the early 2000s ... grabbing parts in the TV shows "Ed" and "Third Watch" ... before landing his breakout part in "The Wire."
      

          James played Ziggy Sobotka -- a dock worker and gangster -- in all 12 episodes of the show's second season. His performance received critical acclaim, with some online even calling him one of their favorite characters on the show.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Ransone's other credits include ... "CSI: Crime Scene Investigation," "Hawaii Five-0," "Burn Notice," "Tangerine," and the Stephen King film, "It: Chapter Two."
      
    
          He had a part in "The Black Phone" and "The Black Phone 2" ... the latter of which was released earlier this year.
      
    
          Ransone was 46.
      
    
          RIP
      
    
          If you or someone you know is struggling or in crisis, help is available. Call or text 988 or chat 988lifeline.org.

title: Shawn Porter Says Terence Crawford Thought About Retiring 'For A Long Time'
description:
Shawn Porter
                          Bud Wanted To Retire For Awhile
body:
Shawn Porter
                          Bud Wanted To Retire For Awhile
                          ... I Knew It Was Over After Canelo!
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              December 22, 2025
                            12:30 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    TMZSports.com
          
    
          Terence "Bud" Crawford's retirement this week shocked many, but not Shawn Porter ... 'cause he tells TMZ Sports the boxing champion had been talking about hanging up the gloves for "a long time."
      
    
          In fact, Porter says Crawford began talking about the end of his boxing career just before their 2021 fight at the Mandalay Bay Resort & Casino in Las Vegas.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          "I knew once he fought Canelo [Alvarez], he felt like there was nothin' left for him," Porter said.
      

          "This is my first time saying -- I never told anyone -- that this is something that he's been thinking about doing for a long time, wanting to do for a long time, but he knew that he had a little bit more to do."
      
    
          Porter -- who retired after their 2021 fight -- says boxers don't just walk away on a whim or out of emotion ... it's a "calculated" decision that comes only when the time is right.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          When it comes to the Mount Rushmore of boxing ... Porter said Crawford is up there with Oleksandr Usyk in that era of the sport.
      
    
          "To get it done despite all of these things coming at him ... he did it."

title: Ethan Slater Seen Supporting Ariana Backstage at 'SNL'
description:
Ethan Slater
                          Supports Ariana Grande from 'SNL' Green Room
body:
Ethan Slater
                          Supports Ariana Grande from 'SNL' Green Room
                          ...Still Going Strong!
                      
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Ethan Slater and Ariana Grande are proving the naysayers wrong, 'cause Ethan was making himself comfy in Ari's 'SNL' green room as she hosted Saturday night's show!
      
    
          Ari's former Nickelodeon co-star and bestie -- Liz Gillies -- posted a series of pics backstage at the 'SNL' taping ... and in one, Ethan is seen sitting alongside Liz on the couch -- showing ongoing breakup rumors are a bunch of BS.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Fans have been a bit skeptical lately about where the 'Wicked' stars' relationship lies. Ethan was recently asked about working alongside his girlfriend, and his answer raised fans' eyebrows when he pivoted to talking about the cast as a whole -- sounding the alarm that the two might be over 'For Good.'
      

                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Since the split rumors began for the couple -- rumors we were told were untrue, BTW -- eagle-eyed fans have been on high alert for any sign that the two are donezo. But with this recent photo dump, the speculation proves to be just that.
      
    
          Sources close to the couple told us back in November the showbiz couple is still absolutely together romantically ... and it looks like they'll be ringing in the new year together!

title: JoJo Siwa's Boyfriend Chris Hughes Says He Plans to Propose When Least Expected
description:
JoJo Siwa
                          Boyfriend Chris Hughes Reveals Engagement Plans ...
body:
JoJo Siwa
                          Boyfriend Chris Hughes Reveals Engagement Plans ...
                          Gotta Take Her By Surprise!!!
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              December 21, 2025
                            5:48 PM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          JoJo Siwa and her man Chris Hughes have clearly discussed engagement details ... because Hughes dished on a few specifics about a potential proposal.
      
    
          The singer and beau gave The Sun an update on their relationship Sunday ... and, the conversation turned to all things engagement -- including the right and wrong time to pop the question.
      
    
        Waiting for your permission to load the Instagram Media.
      
    
          In the clip, Hughes says he's against getting engaged on an obvious milestone day like Christmas for example ... claiming it takes away the surprise from the proposal.
      

          JS seemed into the idea ... joking that Chris is trying to keep her guessing -- though she did give it some thought before stamping the idea with a seal of approval.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          However, one nontraditional engagement practice the two won't participate in is Siwa popping the question to Hughes ... because he says he wants to buy the ring and ask her to marry him.
      
    
          JoJo won't wait forever though ... telling Hughes he's got seven years to ask her -- or she'll ask him. Clock's ticking down to 2032!
      
    
      
        
              
    
    
          Anyhoo ... keep your head on a swivel, JoJo -- because a surprise engagement could be right around the corner!
